question:
An organization has given an advertisement for a part-time job for local children. Write a letter to the administrator of the organization. In your letter
Introduce yourself
Why you think you are suitable for the job
State when you will be able to join that job
text: I am writing this letter because of the story that was published in Daily Bugal newspaper last Friday about the part-time employment offer for young local children. I hope that position is still available.

My name is Sky, I am 16 years old and I completed my primary school from Delhi Public School with good grade. I am independent person and I like to do things on my own, I even organized many competitions during my time at school, I even partipated in some of the cooking events and won several prizes and my aim is to become one of the greatest chef's like Salt Bae.

The main reason why I am more worty candidate for this job is it includes cooking, and I have some good experience with this and most importantly I love this profession. This will help me personally as I can add this to my resume for my further studies as well. Coming to my joining date I will be available from next Wednesday as I have to wind up few things related to my studies. I hope you consider me for this position.
I look forward to hear from you.

error_list.error_des: It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
The noun phrase good grade seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
It seems that grade may not agree in number with other words in this phrase.
The noun phrase independent person seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
If you do not want partipated to be marked as misspelled in the future, you can add it to your personal dictionary.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
If you do not want worty to be marked as misspelled in the future, you can add it to your personal dictionary.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
The verb hear is usually in the gerund form when following the word look forward to. Consider replacing it with the -ing form.
If you do not want sincearly to be marked as misspelled in the future, you can add it to your personal dictionary.
